contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Finnish Municipality |name = Närpes |official_name = {{lang|sv|Närpes stad}} |native_name = |nickname = |settlement_type = Town |motto = |image_skyline = Närpes church.jpg |imagesize = |image_caption = Närpes Church |image_shield = Närpiö.vaakuna.svg |image_map = Närpiö.sijainti.suomi.2008.svg |mapsize = |map_caption = Location of Närpes in [[Finland]] |dot_mapsize = |dot_map_caption = |dot_x = |dot_y = |pushpin_map = <!-- name of a location map as per Template:Location_map --> |pushpin_label_position = <!-- position of the pushpin label: left, right, top, bottom, none --> |pushpin_map_caption = |pushpin_mapsize = |province = [[Western Fingerland]] |region = [[Ostrobothnia (region)|Ostrobothnia]] |subregion = Sydösterbotten sub-region |leader_title = [[City manager]] |leader_name = Hans-Erik Lindqvist |leader_title1 = |leader_name1 = |leader_title2 = |leader_name2 = |leader_title3 = |leader_name3 = |established_title = [[Charter]] |established_date = 1867 |established_title2 = [[Town privileges|City rights]] |established_date2 = 1993 |established_title3 = |established_date3 = |area_urban_km2 = |area_metro_km2 = |population_metro = |population_blank1_title = |population_blank1 = |population_density_metro_km2 = |population_urban = |population_density_urban_km2 = |finnish_official = |swedish_official = 1 |sami_official = |latd=62 |latm=28 |lats= |longd=021 |longm=20 |longs= |elevation_m = |postal_code = |website = [http://www.narpes.fi/ www.narpes.fi] |footnotes = }} '''Närpes''' ({{lang-fi|Närpiö}}) is a [[List of cities and towns in Finland|town]] and [[Municipalities of Finland|municipality]] of [[Finland]]. The [[Municipalities of Finland|municipality]] is located in the [[provinces of Finland|province]] of [[Western Finland]] and is part of the [[Ostrobothnia (region)|Ostrobothnia]] [[regions of Finland|region]]. The town has a population of {{formatnum: {{Infobox Finnish Municipality/population count|Närpes}}}} ({{#time: j F Y|{{Infobox Finnish Municipality/population count|sourcedate}} }})<ref name="population_count" /> and covers an area of {{convert|{{Infobox Finnish Municipality/total area|Närpes}}|km2}} of which {{convert|{{Infobox Finnish Municipality/waters area|Närpes}}|km2|abbr=on}} is water.<ref name="total_area" /> The [[population density]] is {{convert|{{Infobox Finnish Municipality/population density|Närpes|round=2}}|PD/km2}}. The town is unilingually [[Finland-Swedish|Swedish]]-speaking. Many inhabitants speak a very archaic Swedish dialect that has been unaffected by many modern developments and resembles [[Old Swedish]]. There are many bands who sing in their dialect, e.g. [[1G3B]] and [[Nektor]]. Economically, the municipality is known for extensive [[greenhouse]] farming of [[tomato]]es. ==Sister cities== Närpes is [[town twinning|twinned]] with: * {{flagicon|Iceland}} [[Akranes]], Iceland * {{flagicon|Norway}} [[Bamble]], Norway * {{flagicon|Denmark}} [[Tønder]], Denmark * {{flagicon|Sweden}} [[Västervik Municipality]], Sweden ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat-inline|Närpes}} *[http://www.narpes.fi/ Town of Närpes] – Official website *{{Wikivoyage-inline}} {{ostrobothnia}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Narpes}} [[Category:Municipalities of Ostrobothnia Region]] [[Category:Cities and towns in Finland]] [[Category:Populated coastal places in Finland]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1867]] {{WesternFinland-geo-stub}}
